JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , the former Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant worked at an engineering plant . Under her contract , the plant was to provide her with a at . The plant defaulted on this obligation , and the applicant brought a civil action .
On DATE the ORG ordered the plant to “ give the applicant a at that would offer CARDINAL m² per family member ” . This judgment became binding on DATE .
On DATE the Presidium of the ORG quashed the judgment on supervisory - review and ordered a rehearing .

On DATE the regional court ordered the plant to “ give the applicant a at for CARDINAL persons in accordance with applicable laws on housing ” . This judgment became binding on DATE , was submitted to a bailiff for enforcement , but was not enforced immediately .

On DATE the bailiff ﬁned the administration of the plant for its failure to comply with the judgment . On appeal , this ﬁne was quashed , because the plant did take steps to comply with the judgment , and because the applicant had rejected PERSON proposed by the plant .

On DATE the bailiff closed the enforcement proceedings , because the applicant had refused the ats offered by the plant . On DATE the town court ordered the bailiff to resume the proceedings , because the FAC refused by the applicant had been of an improper quality .

On DATE the bailiff ﬁned the administration of the plant for its failure to comply with the judgment . On appeal , this ﬁne was quashed , because , among other reasons , the plant had no available ats .
On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the bailiff ﬁned the administration of the plant for its failure to comply with the judgment .

On DATE and DATE the bailiff warned the administration of the plant about criminal responsibility for non - compliance with binding judgments . On DATE the bailiff asked the police to prosecute the manager of the plant , but the police refused because the manager had no case to answer .

On DATE the bailiff asked the court to clarify the judgment , because the applicant and the plant argued how many square metres per person the at was to offer . On DATE the town court clariﬁed the judgment .
Under section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE , a bailiff must enforce a judgment in DATE .
